title: Constantine Bay to Harlyn Bay Circular Walk Route

images.title: Brian Rodda / South of Treyarnon Bay
images.caption: South of Treyarnon Bay Photographed in May 2005. Just South of Treyarnon Bay (the bay to the right). The sandy beach in the distance is Constantine Bay. The flowers are Thrift, a common flower around this area at this time of year.

images.title: Lighthouse at Trevose Head by Amanda King, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lighthouse at Trevose Head

images.title: Philip Halling / The Padstow Lifeboat Station
images.caption: The Padstow Lifeboat Station viewed across Polventon Bay.

images.title: Philip Halling / Harlyn Bay
images.caption: The beautiful sandy beach of Harlyn Bay pictured here on a sunny October day. Cataclews Point is on the far side of the bay.

images.title: The Road Through the Golf Course by Tony Atkin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Road Through the Golf Course

description: This circular walk takes you from Constantine Bay to Harlyn Bay on the Cornish coast. The walk starts from the car park at Constantine Bay where you'll find a popular surfing beach. From here you can pick up the South West Coast Path and follow it north to Trevose Head . At the northern tip of the headland there's the Trevose lighthouse and some splendid views to enjoy. The route then heads south along Polventon Bay to Harlyn Bay where there's another lovely beach. Here you can turn west to follow inland paths to Constantine Bay village where there are the remains of the ancient St Constantine's Church. From the village it is a short stroll back to the car park where the route finishes. You can extend your walking in the area by heading to nearby Padstow on the Padstow to Harlyn Bay Walk .
